title: Women of the silent era : Virgins, vamps and heroines
creator_credit: National Film and Sound Archive of Australia
brief_description: This delightful selection of moving images from the past shows on screen roles and highlights the off camera activities of women, in the pioneering days of Australias silent cinema. The featured scenes are from the following films: A Maidens distress (1911) ; The Joan of Arc of Loos (1916) ; The Woman suffers (1918) ; The Breaking of the Drought (1920) ; Sunshine Sally (1922) ; Jewelled nights (1925) ; Painted daughters (1925) ; Those who love (1926) ; The Far Paradise (1928) ; The Cheaters (1929).
